feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:44PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ..Elevated Surf From Cape Lisburne to Point Barrow Through Tonight... Northwest winds of 15 mph blowing over the Arctic Coast from Cape Lisburne to Point Barrow will continue tonight, then decrease on Saturday. These winds, combined with slightly elevated sea levels, are causing elevated surf with minor beach erosion along the coast
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 1:53PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf From The Bering Strait to Point Hope Through Monday... Northwest winds of 15 to 30 mph are expected to develop tonight over the southern Chukchi Sea continue into Monday. This will cause elevated surf with minor beach erosion along the coast from the Bering Strait to Point Hope.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 7:37PM MST until August 12 at 7:45PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 745 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL MOHAVE COUNTY... The heavy rain has ended. Flooding is no longer expected to pose a threat. Please continue to heed remaining road closures. A Flood Watch remains in effect until 100 AM MST Sunday for portions of northwest Arizona, southeast California and Nevada.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 6:02PM MST until August 12 at 11:15PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR MARICOPA AND EAST CENTRAL LA PAZ COUNTIES... At 602 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Jackrabbit Wash. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 7:13PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Nez Perce and southeastern Asotin Counties through 745 PM PDT... At 713 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Paradise, or 25 miles south of Lewiston, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail.
